tweet: Decentralisation trade-offs, oracle edition. After reviewing the numerous options @synthetix_io decided to implement @chainlink ~6 months ago. We viewed moving the oracle out of our control as critical to the success and growth of Synthetix. This thread is about why. 1/8

Ladies and gentlemen, I'm proud to announce we have our 21st node operator, milestone achieved 😎  Congrats and welcome to Infinity Stones to the ETH/USD Reference Data Network! #Chainlink $LINK  https://t.co/ka73nxBvyV

The system + dApps are back up! Our new synths are sDEFI and iDEFI, which give you long/short exposure to a DEFI basket; sXRP and iXRP, long/short exposure to Ripple; sLINK and iLINK, long/short exposure to LINK; and sLTC and iLTC, long/short exposure to Litecoin. $LINK $XRP $LTC

🥁 Public Announcement to $LINK Marines..  Block Journal will release our interview tomorrow with the man himself.. @SergeyNazarov of @chainlink!  Like & RT if you're ready to watch it!  https://t.co/wUbAp09LWK

The #Chainlink ETH/USD Reference Contract now has the same level of decentralization as the entire EOS blockchain; 21 nodes  But since the contract resides on #Ethereum (thousands of nodes), it is much more censorship-resistant and immutable  This is just the beginning folks 💹🚀  https://t.co/QdgGfgGg68
$LINK (USD)  Already halfway to the area that I am watching.  https://t.co/RM1WTxnIM6

#DeFi requires highly decentralized price feeds, this is the process  1. Data Providers aggregate price data from multiple exchanges  2. #Chainlink nodes aggregate price data from multiple data providers  3. On-chain contracts aggregate multiple responses creating reference price  https://t.co/bTRj6HdMZV

The critical takeaway is you don’t need, and it can be suboptimal, to be maximally decentralised. You simply need to be sufficiently decentralised for the current environment. And I’m very confident @chainlink will keep us outside of the ever expanding censorship risk bubble.

There’s been some criticism of this choice due to the fact that Chainlink is not maximially decentralised. My response to that is great! A maximally decentralised oracle would simply not work for us. It would be a case of overfitting for one constraint and breaking others. 3/8

We are very comfortable not using maximally decentralised oracles, because chainlink is more than sufficient to move the oracle attack vector to the bottom of our censorship vector stack. Which means governance and other issues become the highest priority. 5/8

Alts have rallies from time to time. $LEND $RLC $LINK $SEELE $VET to name a few had great runs in the past months.  Rest of the time tough, they're busy being trash and are slowly dying / going to zero.  95% of alts will never see their ATH's again. Ever. Get over it.
